companyDescription:
Agoda is transforming travel for millions of customers across the globe. 

Headquartered in Asia, Agoda is one of the world’s largest online travel platforms. Founded in 2005 and now part of Booking Holdings (Nasdaq:BKNG), Agoda has a network of over 2,900,000 properties worldwide. Our web and mobile products provide a first-rate reservation service in 38 languages that uniquely combines local knowledge and local connections to provide the best deals for business and leisure travelers.

Agoda employs over 7,000 professionals from 90 nationalities in locations around the globe. In every department – from engineering to customer experience – we provide an environment rich with creativity, collaboration, and experimentation, and the tools to work faster and smarter.

At Agoda, we believe our people are our strength. We work hard and have fun, and we choose people who are dedicated to making things great.

For properties seeking partnership with Agoda, visit https://connect.agoda.com

jobDescription:
Job Description

À propos de BGIS

BGIS est un chef de file de la prestation de services immobiliers et de services personnalisés de gestion des installations. Grâce à notre équipe combinée de plus de 6 500 personnes à l’échelle mondiale, nous encourageons sans cesse l’innovation par l’intermédiaire des services que nous offrons, tout en cherchant activement de nouvelles occasions qui stimuleront la créativité pour les entreprises de nos clients. Nous gérons des portefeuilles clients comptant plus de 320 millions de pieds carrés de superficie dans plus de 30 000 emplacements en Amérique du Nord, en Europe, au Moyen-Orient, en Australie et en Asie.

Vous trouverez des renseignements supplémentaires au www.bgis.com/fr.

SOMMAIRE

Le chargé de projet planifie et supervise la réalisation complète des projets attribués et veille à ce qu'elle respecte le champ d'application, le budget et les exigences.

Pour ce poste :

Les projets impliquent généralement une complexité, des risques et une exposition modérés.

PRINCIPALES ATTRIBUTIONS ET RESPONSABILITÉS

Pour les projets attribués :
Planifier et superviser la réalisation complète des projets attribués. Pour ce poste, les projets gérés impliquent généralement une complexité, des risques et une exposition modérés.En collaboration avec les intervenants du projet, définir le champ d'application, les résultats attendus et les exigences.Élaborer et mettre en œuvre les plans de projets.Établir les exigences relatives aux ressources et au budget, l'estimation des coûts et le calendrier.Évaluer les risques des projets et élaborer et mettre en œuvre des plans d'atténuation et d'intervention d'urgence.Surveiller la réalisation des projets par rapport au calendrier établi et assurer l'achèvement dans les délais requis.Superviser les activités des membres de l'équipe des projets et surveiller l'exécution des tâches.Aviser les intervenants appropriés du statut des projets.Veiller à ce que les projets soient réalisés dans les délais prescrits, en respect avec le champ d'application, le budget et les exigences, et s'assurer qu'ils sont conformes aux exigences réglementaires et aux normes en matière d'environnement, de santé et de sécurité.

Gestion des relations avec les clients
Développer et maintenir de bonnes relations avec les clients.Prendre en charge la résolution des problèmes, la gestion des attentes des clients et assurer la satisfaction de la clientèle.Accomplir d'autres tâches assignées.

CONNAISSANCES THÉORIQUES ET PRATIQUES 
Diplôme d'études collégiales, de préférence en technologie de l'architecture, de la construction ou de l'ingénierie, ou expérience professionnelle équivalente;Expérience professionnelle de trois (3) à cinq (5) ans en gestion de projets;Excellente capacité à réaliser des projets dans les délais prescrits, selon le budget établi et en conformité avec les spécifications et toutes les exigences, y compris, notamment, les exigences réglementaires et les normes en matière d'environnement, de santé et de sécurité;Capacité supérieure à élaborer et à gérer le budget des projets;Capacité supérieure à réduire et à gérer les risques liés aux projets;Excellente capacité à influencer, à persuader et à négocier de manière à obtenir les résultats escomptés;Excellentes compétences en communication et en relations interpersonnelles;Excellente capacité à développer et à maintenir des relations avec les intervenants des projets;Capacité supérieure à gérer les relations avec les clients et les attentes de la clientèle;Grand sens du service à la clientèle;Capacité à gérer les relations avec les fournisseurs et leur rendement;Avoir une attitude permettant une amélioration continue et une réalisation de qualité, ainsi que le désir de chercher et d'intégrer les pratiques exemplaires et les technologies de manière à optimiser la réalisation des projets et à offrir aux clients une valeur ajoutée.Maîtrise des applications de la Suite Office en particulier – MS Project, MS Excel, MS Outlook, et capacité à rapidement apprendre à utiliser de nouvelles applications.Bilinguisme.

Licences et/ou Accréditation Professionnelle

Au moins un(e) des suivant(e)s constituerait un atout :
Accréditation d'un établissement de gestion de projet ou être en voie de l'obtenirCertification LEED ou être en voie de l'obtenir

Chez BGIS, nous croyons en la diversité et l'inclusion comme moteurs commerciaux clés, de sorte que nous ne perdons jamais de vue de son importance car elle est tissée dans le tissu de notre organisation. Nous nous engageons à maintenir un processus de recrutement sans obstacle en offrant des opportunités d'emploi équitables grâce au recrutement et à la sélection d'individus de tous horizons. Nous reconnaissons que la promotion de la diversité est un élément essentiel de notre quête du succès organisationnel!
companyDescription:
BGIS is a global leader in the provision of Facility Management, Project Delivery, Energy & Sustainability, Asset Management, Workplace Advisory, and Real Estate Services. With a combined team of over 9,000 globally, BGIS relentlessly focuses on delivering innovative service solutions that create value for its clients. Globally, BGIS manages over 40,000 facilities totalling more than 320 million square feet across several markets including government, higher education, utilities, telecommunications, financial services, oil & gas, healthcare and cloud enterprise. In addition to managing a diverse portfolio of corporate offices, retail, colleges, hospitals and industrial assets, BGIS is a world leader in the management of data centers and other critical environments.

-

BGIS est un fournisseur de services personnalisés de gestion des installations, de services de livraison de projets, de solutions énergétiques et de développement durable, de gestion de la performance des bâtiments, de conseil et de gestion des lieux de travail et de services immobiliers. 7 000 membres d’équipe à l'échelle mondiale. Plus de 320 millions de pieds carrés de portefeuilles clients répartis sur plusieurs marchés, notamment ceux des gouvernements, de l’enseignement supérieur, des services publics, des télécommunications, des services financiers, du pétrole et du gaz, des soins de santé et de l’information dans les nuages. En plus de gérer un portefeuille diversifié de bureaux, de commerces de détail, de collèges, d'hôpitaux et d'actifs industriels, BGIS est un leader mondial de la gestion de centres de données et d'autres environnements critiques.

jobDescription:
Job Description

SASKATOON

We are a global leader in the Earth and Environment sector. Globally headquartered in Montreal, where it all began, we proudly serve communities from coast to coast and beyond. We have over 14,000 multidisciplinary professionals worldwide collaborating daily to protect and conserve natural landscapes, create firm foundations for communities to stand on, and champion sustainable development to combat climate change.

As part of the team, you will have access to an unparalleled network of resources, expertise, and endless opportunities to collaborate on exciting projects with diverse teammates from marine biologists to geophysicists to geotechnical engineers and more.

The Opportunity:

You will work with an integrated and collaborative team of Hydrologists and Water Resources Engineers. Our projects involve hydrology assessments, water resources and river engineering, hydraulic structure design, and regulatory application support locally in Saskatchewan, in Alberta and the North for a wide variety of clients.

Why WSP?
We value and are committed to upholding a culture of Inclusion and BelongingOur Flexible Work Policy – we recognize the importance of balance in our lives and encourage you to prioritize the balance in yours. We will support you on and off the job so you can be fully present in both your work and home lives. Our Hybrid Work Policy - a combination of in-person and remote working, enables us to purposefully think of how we work, who we need to work with, and where the work should be done. A Canadian success story - we're proud to wear the red and white of this beautiful country and show the world what Canada has to offer.Enhance the world around you - from the environment to the highways, to the buildings and the terrain, WSP is the fabric of Canada.Outstanding career opportunities - we're growing and pushing ourselves every day to be greater than yesterday - we're open to your ideas and trying new things.A phenomenal collaborative culture and a workforce filled with genuinely good people who are doing humbly important work. Come find out for yourself what it's like to be a part of our journey.

We offer attractive pay, flexible work options, a great corporate culture, comprehensive and employee-focused benefits including virtual healthcare and a wellness platform as well as great savings programs, and a clear vision for the future.

#WeAre WSP 

A day in the life:
You’ll be using your expertise to lead and complete water resources and river engineering tasks from assessments and studies to conceptual and detailed design;You’ll be developing field data collection plans, managing projects, and writing technical reports;You’ll be collaborating with our many counterparts in all our different disciplines at WSP and providing expertise and client deliverables on projects;You’ll be managing relationships with internal and external clients and ensuring that their needs are understood and met, by providing your guidance and expertise; and,You’ll provide direction and mentorship to more junior staff.

 What you'll bring to WSP ...
Bachelor or Master Degree in Civil Engineering, Water Resources Engineering, or Environmental Engineering;Eligible for registration as professional engineer in Saskatchewan;Minimum of 5 years experience with hydrology assessments and/or water resources engineering;Experience with detailed design, tendering, and construction supervision would be an asset;Commitment to technical excellence;Team player with strong communication skills;You want to experience what it’s like to work for the leading environmental consulting firm globally and be part of a growing and thriving team!

About Us

 WSP  is one of the world's leading professional services firms. Our purpose is to future proof our cities and environments.

We have over 65,000 team members across the globe. In Canada, our 12,000+ people are involved in everything from environmental remediation to urban planning, from engineering iconic buildings to designing sustainable transportation networks, from finding new ways to extract essential resources to developing renewable power sources for the future.

At WSP:
We value our people and our reputationWe are locally dedicated with international scaleWe are future focused and challenge the status quoWe foster collaboration in everything we doWe have an empowering culture and hold ourselves accountable

Please Note:

Health and Safety is a core paramount value of WSP. Given the importance of keeping one another safe and the growing list of our clients including vaccination status as part of their mandated health and safety requirements to work with them, you will be required to provide proof of full COVID-19 vaccination to WSP as a condition of employment. You may also be required to undergo additional immunization to maintain a fully vaccinated status against COVID-19 whenever local Public Health Authorities recommend additional immunization.

Offers of employment for safety-sensitive positions involving fieldwork are contingent upon candidates being able to perform key physical tasks of the job as described in the job posting and interview. This may include the ability to work in a variety of environmental conditions, such as remote or isolated areas, working alone, and in inclement weather (within safe and reasonable limits).

WSP welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

WSP is committed to the principles of employment equity. Only the candidates selected will be contacted.

WSP does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies. For more information please  READ THE FULL POLICY. 

WSP Canada Inc.
companyDescription: Named to LinkedIn's list of Top Companies in Canada for two years running, WSP is one of the world's leading professional services consulting firms. We are dedicated to our local communities and propelled by international expertise. We are technical experts and strategic advisors including engineers, technicians, scientists, planners, landscape architects and urban designers, surveyors and environmental specialists, as well as other design, program and construction management professionals. We design lasting solutions in the Buildings, Transportation, Infrastructure, Environment, Geomatics, Energy, Resources, and Industrial sectors as well as project delivery and strategic consulting services. With over 8,000 talented people across Canada, we engineer projects that will help societies grow for generations to come.

jobTitle: Chargé.e de projet en REMISE EN SERVICE DE BÂTIMENTS (RCx)
jobDescription:
Qui nous sommesAkonovia, c’est avant tout une compagnie à taille humaine avec des valeurs clés, centrées sur l’expérience employé et client. Notre équipe propose des services d’accompagnement dans plusieurs spécialités en efficacité énergétique et en carboneutralité : simulations énergétiques, audits énergétiques, appuis financiers, mise en service, remise en service, formations, géothermie et système de gestion de l’énergie.Convaincus par la nécessité et l’urgence d’une transition énergétique, nous collaborons avec nos clients et partenaires pour les accompagner dans leurs projets, et ce tout au long de leurs processus. Véritablement neutres et proactifs dans nos missions, nous sommes à l’écoute de nos clients et les guidons pour prendre des décisions qui répondent à leur besoin. Être toujours en avant de la vague, proposer des solutions efficaces et durables, guider le client dans une ambiance de travail agréable, établir une relation de confiance avec nos partenaires, voici ce qui nous motive chez Akonovia.Conscients que notre succès repose sur l’expertise, les compétences et la personnalité de chaque membre de notre équipe, nous mettons beaucoup d’efforts pour offrir la meilleure expérience employée possible. Au-delà du CV, nous accordons une grande importance à l’humain qui s’y cache derrière et nous veillons à préserver une belle harmonie dans notre équipe : savoir-être, respect, bienveillance et attitude positive sont nos meilleurs alliés. Ambiance décontractée et sérieuse quand il le faut, Akonovia se veut être une firme pour laquelle on est content et fier de travailler.
Nos bureauxL'équipe Akonovia, l’AkonoTeam, est présente dans différentes régions au Québec et en Ontario. Nous avons un bureau physique à Montréal et à Sherbrooke. Nous avons aussi des collègues à Québec, Toronto, Ottawa, Calgary, Alma et même Alger!
Qui sont nos clients et partenairesDepuis sa création, Akonovia a su bâtir de solides relations de collaboration avec ses clients et partenaires : Industriel (usines, serres agricoles), Institutionnel (CIUSSS, CISSS, universités, municipalités, gouvernement du Québec, gouvernement du Canada), Commercial (tours de bureaux, centre commerciaux), Résidentiel (promoteurs immobiliers), Hydro Québec et Energir.Chez Akonovia, nous avons la chance de pouvoir combiner les avantages d’une petite structure avec ceux des compagnies de plus grande envergure. Concrètement, les membres de notre équipe prennent part aux décisions de la compagnie et participent activement à sa croissance. L’innovation tient une part importante dans notre philosophie d’entreprise et l’apport de chacun est bienvenu. Nous sommes à l’écoute des besoins et champs d’intérêts professionnels de chaque personnalité qui intègre notre équipe, et lui offrons l’opportunité de travailler sur des projets parmi les plus importants au Québec dans le domaine des bâtiments durables.   Ce que seraient ton rôle et tes responsabilitésLa croissance d’Akonovia avec son carnet de commandes rempli de projets stimulants, nous pousse aujourd’hui à agrandir notre équipe et ce, dans plusieurs services. Sous la responsabilité du Vice-Président Bâtiments et Procédés, et à titre de CHARGÉ.E DE PROJETS EN REMISE EN SERVICE DE BÂTIMENTS (RCx) tu seras amené.e à :Planifier, coordonner et diriger le processus de remise en service (RCx) dans son entièreté;Travailler avec les clients pour définir les stratégies de remise en service (RCx) afin d'optimiser les performances des systèmes de bâtiment et d'installation.Coordonner avec les autres membres de l'équipe la portée des travaux, les tâches, les calendriers, les livrables et les responsabilités pour la mise en œuvre du plan de remise en service;Avoir la charge de mener à bien toutes les étapes clés du plan de remise en service : planification, investigation, implantation, transfert et suivi en continu;Animer les rencontres avec les clients en fonction du programme;Analyser les résultats d’audits énergétiques précédents, faire la visite des bâtiments et investiguer leur opération par un audit approfondi des installations et une révision complète des séquences de contrôle et des équipements mécaniques;Examiner et optimiser les performances des systèmes de contrôle des bâtiments pour garantir l'efficacité et l'optimisation de la gestion de la maintenance;Faire des entrevues avec le personnel technique sur site;Organiser et participer aux essais fonctionnels sur le site;Effectuer des diagnostics sur les équipements principaux;Coordonner l’implantation des mesures et de leur mise en service, de concert avec le client;Assurer les activités de formation du personnel technique chez le client;Rédiger des rapports techniques clairs et concis pour transmettre des informations pertinentes aux clients et aux parties prenantesRédiger le plan de Recommissioning;Aider à la mise en place de systèmes de commissioning en continu pour assurer une surveillance et une optimisation continues des performances des bâtiments et des installations.Gérer plusieurs projets simultanément pour fournir un service de qualité dans les délais impartis.Participer à la préparation des demandes de subventions pour les projets de remise en service afin d'obtenir le financement nécessaire pour les projets.Rester à l’affut des possibilités d’affaire Ce que tu es / ce que tu asEn termes de liste à cocher, nous ne faisons pas dans l’originalité; voici les qualifications et compétences que nous recherchons pour ce poste : DEC, Baccalauréat ou maitrise en mécanique du bâtiment, électromécanique, efficacité énergétique, ou autre domaine connexe à la remise en service;Avoir au minimum 5 ans d’expérience en remise en service de bâtiment, en contrôle DDC, en conception ou dans un domaine pertinent;Accréditation RCx (un atout)Excellente compréhension du fonctionnement et du contrôle des équipements mécaniques et de ses séquences de contrôleExcellente compréhension des systèmes de mécanique du bâtimentExpérience préalable en CVAC et / ou en automatisation du bâtimentPédagogue et sait communiquer clairement ses idées;Être capable de vulgariser des notions techniques;Structuré et organiséAvoir un bon relationnelDe bonnes aptitudes rédactionnellesÊtre autonomeCapacité d’adaptation aux situations et aux profils de clientsApporter ta touche personnelle à l’équipe Vu les responsabilités que requiert le poste, nous sommes à la recherche d’une personne qui saura faire preuve de leadership pour assurer le succès des projets de remise en service. Nous avons de très beaux projets et d’envergure sur la table, sans compter sur la belle relation de travail que nous avons développée avec nos clients au fil du temps. Cette confiance gagnée, nous souhaitons la perpétuer avec toi!Alors si tu te sens prêt.e à relever ce défi et à apporter ta couleur à notre belle équipe, envoie-nous ta candidature!
Ce que nous t’offronsPossibilité de travailler 4 jours par semaine ;Semaine de 34h Formule hybride télétravail et bureau ;Horaires de travail flexibles (en autant que les livrables soient respectés) pour favoriser la balance vie privée/vie professionnelle;Ordinateur portable, téléphone et prime télétravail de 800$ pour ton installation;Ambiance de travail décontractée. Tu auras des collègues allumés et réellement fun à travailler avec;Opportunités de formations à l’interne et à l’externe en fonction de tes besoins et exigences du poste;Avantages sociaux atteignant 4.5% de ton salaire annuel brut; utilisation fexible de ce montant entre la cotisation au REER collectif et à plateforme TEDY;Programme Bien être (télémedecine, aide juridique, santé mentale…);Accès au gym gratuit (pour le bureau de Montréal);Participation à des activités en équipe (AkonoFun) pour passer du bon temps avec tes collègues, loin des dossiers;Opportunité d’avoir un rôle clé au sein d’une entreprise en pleine croissance;Bénéficier d’une grande autonomie dans la réalisation de ton travail et opportunités d’innover et contribuer à façonner la culture de l’entreprise.
Tes collèguesL’AkonoTeam est composée de profils variés : certains d’entre nous sont de jeunes professionnels, d’autres ont une vingtaine d’années d’expérience. L’équipe est formée d’ingénieurs, de techniciens et de profils plutôt administratif…aux diverses origines culturelles : Québec, France, Algérie, Chine, Iran, Grèce, Haiti, Cameroun, d’amateurs de sport ou pas, de personnes sympathiques, allumées avec autant de femmes que d’hommes…en somme, une belle diversité qui fait nos valeurs et nos forces. Pour en apprendre davantage sur Akonovia, tu peux aussi visiter notre page web et LinkedIn.**Seuls les profils qui auront retenu notre attention seront recontactés pour une entrevue. Merci pour ta compréhension.Type d'emploi : Temps PleinSalaire : à discuter selon expérience
companyDescription:
L’Équipe Akonovia vous accompagne dans une démarche collaborative et avant-gardiste pour la construction, l’amélioration et l’exploitation de bâtiments et procédés écoresponsables. 

Notre culture repose sur trois piliers : Accompagner - Collaborer - Innover. Elle est tournée vers nos employés et vous, notre client. 

Nous ne rendons pas simplement des services-conseils, nous vous accompagnons dans votre projet, et conséquemment, votre but devient notre but. Nous servons vos intérêts, nos services doivent vous permettre d'atteindre vos objectifs, votre but.

Peu importe les circonstances, dans le cadre d'un projet pour ou avec un client ou dans le contexte interne d'un travail d'équipe, toujours nous agissons dans un esprit collaboratif, et ce avec tous les intervenants. Car nous croyons que l'objectif du projet, voire l'objectif global de la transition énergétique et l'atteinte de la carboneutralité, devrait transcender toute autre considération.

jobTitle: Computer System Validation (CSV) - Data Integrity Consultant
jobDescription:
PharmEng Technology has been providing quality services to leading manufacturers of healthcare and pharmaceutical products since 1997. Our specialists hold expertise in Commissioning & Qualification, Validation, Quality Systems, Regulatory Affairs, Engineering, and Training to ensure that our clients can keep on providing the world with their cost-effective and high-standard healthcare products.
At PharmEng Technology, we strive to cultivate the best working environment where empowerment, passion and perseverance are nurtured while serving our clients to achieve their unique business goals.

We are seeking an experienced Computer System Validation (CSV) - Data Integrity Consultant for a project in Toronto, Ontario, to help drive our solution-based business model and take our designs to the next level. Our Consultants have the chance to work hands-on with several business divisions to design, develop, test industry-leading solutions for our clients—both nationally and internationally. Our ideal candidate is a creative thinker who shares our passion for making people’s lives easier. 
Job Description: · Preparation of Validation protocols for GxP critical reports;· Configuration of static Master Data objects in a validated/GMP compliant LabWare LIMS (version 6) environment;· Assist in protocol execution, review, and approval;· Generation of Change requests and IT tickets for the validation of reports;· Validation of business intelligence reports and skilled with all the tests required to properly qualify the reports;· Review existing SOPs and prepare draft to serve as the framework for Computer System Validation Projects;· Develop and execute documentation for validation and qualification activities to support various computer system validation projects. Documents to be authored may include URS, FRS, FRA, HLCCD, etc.;· Solve problems during validation process and address/advise on issues such as deficiencies, deviations and change control, etc.;· Ensure compliance of computerized systems to relevant regulatory requirements (e.g., cGMP/GLP/GAMP/GALP);· Draft templates for High level Risk Assessments, User Requirements Specification, Validation Plan and Validation Summary Reports. Prepare Validation Plans, IQ, OQ, Validation Summary Reports;· Acts as liaison between Quality Assurance and project team to assure that GxP software is implemented in compliance with applicable regulations and guidelines;· Responsible for planning and managing a project to successful completion, within the established deadline and within the budget;· Possess excellent management skills to coordinate with the team, the clients, and stakeholders;· Manage day-to-day operational aspects of the project and scope;· Ensure project documents are complete, reviewed, approved, and stored appropriately; and· Keep project team well informed of changes within the project.
Job Requirements: · Bachelor’s degree in business/technical area or comparable education/experience;· A minimum of two (2) to five (5) years’ experience in Computer Systems Validation within the pharmaceutical/biotechnology GMP environment including authoring and execution of IOQ/PQ’s, experience in performing traceability matrices, risk assessments;· Certified LabWare LIMS administrator an asset;· Working knowledge of regulations, such as 21CFR Part 11, Good Automated Manufacturing Practice (GAMP5), GLP and Good Automated Laboratory Practice (GALP);· Solid understanding of data integrity risks;· Ability to manage complex projects and timelines in a matrix team environment;· Ability to independently identify compliance risks and escalate when necessary;· Must be a self-starter with great team communication skills; and· Must have proven ability to lead a team.

Why PharmEng Technology?Our consultants come from different areas of the Pharmaceutical/Biotech/Medical Device industries and have extensive experiences obtained from world-class organizations in North America, Europe, and Asia. At PharmEng Technology, we value everyone’s unique talents and work together to support our clients. We offer continuous career growth, competitive wages, opportunities for travel and a team mentality that sets us apart from our competitors. It is the growth of our staff that continues to grow our company globally.

What We Offer:•Comprehensive benefits package & competitive wages.•A supportive environment where employee growth is promoted.•Paid holidays.•Other great incentives.

Company Response to Covid-19While we serve industries that are deemed essential businesses, PharmEng Technology will follow safe business practices and adhere to local, state and federal guidelines. When possible, PharmEng Technology will allow remote work from home.

EEOC Statement At PharmEng Technology, we don’t just accept difference — we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our clients, and our community. PharmEng Technology is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

Thank you for your consideration and application! We review all resumes and submissions, however, due to the sheer volume of requests that we receive, only successful candidates will be contacted.
companyDescription:
PharmEng Technology is a leading global provider of technical services and solutions to the pharmaceutical, biotechnology, and healthcare industries. With over 25 years of experience, we specialize in Commissioning, Qualification, and Validation (CQV) services for facilities, utilities, equipment, and processes.

Our team of highly skilled professionals brings a wealth of industry expertise and knowledge to every project, ensuring that our clients receive the highest quality services and solutions. We pride ourselves on our ability to provide flexible, innovative, and cost-effective solutions that meet our clients' unique needs and challenges.

At PharmEng Technology, we are committed to delivering excellence in everything we do. We work closely with our clients to understand their goals and objectives and develop customized solutions that deliver measurable results. Our focus on quality, safety, and compliance ensures that our clients can trust us to meet their most critical needs.

As a trusted partner to some of the world's largest pharmaceutical companies, we have a proven track record of success in delivering high-quality technical services and solutions that drive operational efficiency, reduce costs, and enhance overall performance. We are dedicated to helping our clients succeed in an ever-evolving and highly competitive industry.

At PharmEng Technology, we are passionate about what we do, and we are committed to delivering excellence in everything we do.

Specialties: PharmEng Technology specializes in the planning, design, construction, and validation of Health Care, Laboratory, API Pharmaceutical and Biotechnology facilities and equipment, including computer systems. We provide professional services that meet both regulatory and business demands, following current Good Manufacturing Practices (cGMP), Good Engineering Practices (GEP), and Good Laboratory Practices (GLP).

jobDescription:
On behalf of our client in the Retail Sector, PROCOM is looking for a Data Engineer - Machine Learning Ops 
Data Engineer - Machine Learning Ops - Job Description
Design, build, and maintain scalable and efficient data pipelines and machine learning workflows Develop and maintain data models, data warehouses, and ETL processes Implement MLOps best practices to automate model training, deployment, monitoring, and management Collaborate with data scientists and machine learning engineers to integrate models into production systems Optimize data processing and storage to improve system performance and reliability Implement data security and governance best practices Troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues  
Data Engineer - Machine Learning Ops – Mandatory Skills
Bachelor's degree in computer science, Engineering, or related field 1-3 years of experience in MLOps or data engineering with a focus on machine learning Strong programming skills in Python, Java, or Scala Experience with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch Experience with containerization and orchestration tools such as Docker and Kubernetes Experience with MLOps tools such as Kubeflow, MLflow, or TFX Experience with cloud-based data platforms such as Google Cloud Platform Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases Strong problem-solving and analytical skills Excellent communication and collaboration skills  
Data Engineer - Machine Learning Ops - Nice to Have Skills
Master's degree in computer science, Engineering, or related field Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, or Cassandra  
Data Engineer - Machine Learning Ops - Assignment Start Date ASAP – 12 months to start 
Data Engineer - Machine Learning Ops - Assignment Location Mississauga, ON – Work Hybrid

jobDescription:

We are a fast-growing employee-owned firm and IIROC registered securities dealer. The firm provides financial services and holistic wealth management solutions for mid to high-net-worth individuals. At Harbourfront Wealth Management, our core values start with the belief that great people make great companies.  Our head offices are in downtown Vancouver and Burlington Ontario, with over 20 branches across Canada. 
Career opportunity:We currently have a career opportunity for an Operations & Reconciliation Analyst to supplement our operations team to provide support to Harbourfront and Harbourfront Group of Companies. This role will be located at our head office in Vancouver, BC reporting to the Senior Manager of Operations & Transitions. We are looking for a motivated, high performing, results driven candidate.  
Key responsibilities:Performing Fee Reconciliation, billable, and non-billable securities reconciliation analysisExecuting calculations and analysis on platform data outputsConduct Fee and Operation anomaly investigations and resolutionsAudit transactions, holdings, and subsequent performance as requiredSupport ongoing special projects as assignedAnnual Tax slip oversightDaily, monthly, and quarterly statement generation, oversight, and reviewSupport various internal departments to collect and extract data from vendors and internal systemsEnsure procedures are continually maintained to reflect existing activitiesCross train with the user access team to support vacation and increased capacity 
Ideal candidate qualifications:A bachelor’s degree or diploma in Business Administration, Finance, or relevant area of study Minimum 3 years of industry experience, ideally, within an IIROC wealth management firmStrong analytical thinking, understanding of technical information, problem-solving, planning, and organizational skillsStrong proficiency with Microsoft Excel.Experience with IIROC operating systems, such as, ISM, fee management, is considered an asset Completion of the Canadian Securities Course (CSC) is considered an assetStrong written and verbal communication skillsAbility to complete data analysis and reporting for management in specified timelines 
Diversity and InclusionDiversity is an important value to us. We are committed to providing equal opportunities in employment and to providing a workplace which is free from discrimination and harassment. This means that all job applicants and employees will receive equal treatment regardless of race, colour, ethnic or national origins, sex, marital status, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, or belief.
companyDescription: Unlike the large investment institutions, we embody a philosophy of independent, unbiased advice with an unwavering commitment to delivering true wealth management. We do this by offering harmonized advice that intricately weaves defensive portfolio construction, income planning and projecting, tax minimization planning, estate preservation, and trust management, all with a continuous focus on the management of risk. Our advisors located in Harbourfront’s branches across Canada have been carefully selected based on high standards of excellence and integrity. They tailor client wealth plans with no incentive to use proprietary products or investment vehicles.

jobDescription:
Description

If you are looking for a high-impact Lead Mobile Solution Architect. As an EPAMer, you’ll have the opportunity to work with a supportive team, on a variety of interesting projects for some of the biggest brands in the world. Are you ready for the next step in your career journey? Apply now!

companyDescription:
Since 1993, EPAM Systems, Inc. (NYSE: EPAM) has leveraged its advanced software engineering heritage to become the foremost global digital transformation services provider – leading the industry in digital and physical product development and digital platform engineering services. Through its innovative strategy; integrated advisory, consulting, and design capabilities; and unique 'Engineering DNA,' EPAM's globally deployed hybrid teams help make the future real for clients and communities around the world by powering better enterprise, education and health platforms that connect people, optimize experiences, and improve people's lives. In 2021, EPAM was added to the S&P 500 and included among the list of Forbes Global 2000 companies.  

Selected by Newsweek as a 2021 and 2022 Most Loved Workplace, EPAM's global multi-disciplinary teams serve customers in more than 50 countries across six continents. As a recognized leader, EPAM is listed among the top 15 companies in Information Technology Services on the Fortune 1000 and ranked four times as the top IT services company on Fortune's 100 Fastest Growing Companies list. EPAM is also listed among Ad Age's top 25 World's Largest Agency Companies for three consecutive years, and Consulting Magazine named EPAM Continuum a top 20 Fastest Growing Firm.

Learn more at  www.epam.com.

jobDescription:
A Place Where People Matter

Start your career journey today with Univar Solutions!  Here you can make an impact on the world around you and accelerate your career in areas that energize and excite you. 

Located in Canada, as a Product Manager for Univar Solutions Coatings, Adhesives, Sealants, Elastomers (CASE) focused industries, you will manage and drive performance of selected commodity products. This position will provide regional and geographical expertise in designated product areas specific to market conditions and applications. This position will have a strong interface with field sales, field management, product management, and suppliers to optimize profitability.

 Flexible work program Competitive salary, benefits to include; employer paid medical & dental, short term and long term disability coverage, pension with employer matched contributions Paid training and development programs at every level Global career advancement and mentoring opportunities Education allowance Employee Resource Networks that are advocating for advancing diversity, equity and inclusion within the company 

What you’ll do: 
Implement the specific procurement and sales strategy associated with the products, or group of products. Accountable for P&L of select ed products and suppliers within specific geography across all customer segments.Interface with suppliers to develop longer term strategic relationships.Assist in implementation, and execution, of the procurement, supply, sales, marketing, financial and logistical strategy within the regions.Interface with Business Directors, Support Coordinators, and Field Organization.Work closely with District and Regional Management, Operations, and Credit Managers.Perform other related duties as required or requested. 

What you’ll need:
Strong analytical skills needed to develop strategic data driven decisions.Strong working experience with field relationships.Ability to develop and grow strong relationships with key customers and suppliers.High level of decision-making ability balancing customers’ needs and company objectives.Strong organization skills with the ability to handle diverse and significant workload.Strong written, verbal, and presentation skills.Demonstrated financial management skills.Bachelor's degree.Broad knowledge of chemical distribution business and functions.3 + years field or product management experience.

We offer a Total Rewards package that includes market aligned pay and incentives as well as a diverse benefits offering to support our employees' physical, emotional, and financial wellbeing. 

Univar Solutions supports sustainable solutions for the world around us so that we can do our part to keep our communities healthy, fed, clean and safe.

We are committed to a diverse workforce and a culture of inclusion. Together, we are building a culture that acknowledges the unique experiences, perspectives and expertise of individuals and provides the development and growth opportunities to empower us to redefine our industry. 

Univar Solutions is an equal opportunity employer. Company Description

Maximus is an innovative company that designs, manufactures, and markets the Maximus control system for the agricultural industry. Team mission: develop an evolving system at the cutting edge of technology that combines reliability, ease of use, animal welfare and operating savings for optimal farm management. The Maximus team offers you the opportunity to join a dynamic team and offers you an exciting job on the South Shore of Montreal.

The Maximus Group consists of 3 entities: Maximus, Zaxe Technologies and Maximum AG (distributor in the United States).

The Maximus Group is a subsidiary of Ingersoll Rand (NYSE: IR) since 2021.

 Engineering Program Manager 

Job Summary:

The Engineering Program Manager will manage a continuous pipeline of new product and product optimization projects, to grow revenue, expand margin and add product value. This person will manage all aspects of multiple projects simultaneously, from idea to implementation, while leading teams to accomplish specific objectives in a given time frame. This role is accountable for assigned projects' scope of work, schedule, and budget.

Requirements
 Utilize a gated project management process to plan and analyze assigned projects, establish schedules, actions and project parameters, and set procedures to accomplish objectives involving product initiatives. Lead a cross functional project team comprised of engineering, manufacturing, supply chain and product management, suppliers and other stakeholders. Provide project management process direction and support to the project team and stakeholders. Utilize established project management tools to create and maintain project resource plans including labor and expense budget for assigned projects. Responsible for maintaining the accuracy of the forecasted business case at completion, and controlling expenses by monitoring assigned project budget. Assess cross-functional resource requirements and proactively engage sponsors and functional leaders to fill resource gaps on a timely basis to ensure project success. Create and revise risk based project schedules including: generating tasks, estimates, dependencies and milestones. Maintain internal/external customer satisfaction by investigating concerns, implementing corrective action, and communicating with project team and stakeholders. Contribute to the development of standard work and best practices to enable process continuous improvement. Participate in ideation events to generate product improvement opportunities and assist in facilitating.

Qualifications:
 Requires a Bachelor's Degree in Engineering with 8 years of experience with demonstrated cross functional participation or leadership. Experience in resource planning and team building with engineers, manufacturing, supply chain, product management. Proficient in project management techniques, software and tools. Minimal travel to support projects and manufacturing sites.

Key Competencies
 Ability to integrate business, marketing and technical elements of a new product or product optimization project, including anticipating issues and driving countermeasures and issues to closure. Ability to lead multiple project teams simultaneously directly or indirectly through influence. Persistence and tenacity to drive teams to meet or exceed project objectives of Delivery, Quality, Project & Product Cost. Must have financial and business acumen and a proven history of completing projects on time and on budget. Ability to communicate and influence at all levels of the organization. Ability to resolve conflict, to apply critical thinking to solve problems and to escalate when projects are at risk. The individual should be analytical, flexible, team-oriented, have good interpersonal, communication and follow-up skills with a strong drive to bring projects/tasks to completion.

jobTitle: Traffic Signals & Illumination Lead Engineer / Project Manager
jobDescription:
Job Description
Join a global professional services leader. We are committed to solving the world’s biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy and urbanization.
Committed to sustainable & balanced development, GHD improves the physical, natural and social environments of the many communities in which we operate .
Our  Engineering Design Organization  is looking for a proactive go-getter with a can-do attitude who thrives on working collaboratively with various teams in an agile and fast-paced environment. As our Electrical Project Lead working out one of our GTA   offices  you will play an instrumental role on the Electrical team, leading and managing design projects involving traffic signals systems, street lighting and power distribution systems.
 The successful candidate will be responsible for: 
 Delivering projects involving traffic signalization and street lighting systems design. If interested, the candidate can be involved in a wider spectrum of projects, including design of underground / overhead electrical distribution systems for residential, industrial and commercial developments, including new and rehabilitation sites.  Performing and verification of electrical design and photometric calculations  Preparation of detailed specifications and schedules of quantities  Coordination and liaison with clients, approving authorities and outside design team members  Providing direction to and coordination with internal designers/drafting team  Technical review and quality control of design drawings  Sealing of plans  Preparation of proposals and fee estimates  Control of project budgets and timelines for deliverables  Project management  Mentoring of junior staff  Conducting field investigations, inspections, assessments, etc. 
 Skills, Competencies and Qualifications: 
 Degree in Electrical Engineering and is registered with the Professional Engineers of Ontario (PEO)  Minimum 10 years' related experience  Thorough knowledge of industry standards and design guidelines, including Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA), Transportation Association of Canada (TAC) Guidelines for Understanding, Use and Implementation of Accessible Pedestrian Signals, Ontario Traffic Manual OTM Book 12 and 12A, IESNA RP 8 Roadway Lighting, TAC Guide for the Design of Roadway Lighting, Ontario Electrical Safety Code.  Strong organizational, interpersonal and communication skills  Self-motivated and able to manage multiple projects. Aptitude for business development work  Strong analytical skills  Ability to exercise sound judgment and to work independently with minimal supervision. Solid experience with photometric modeling software  Excellent computer skills and general proficiency with MicroStation and AutoCAD  G class driver’s license 
As a diverse and inclusive organization, we encourage individual achievement and recognize the strength of a diverse workforce. GHD is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, GHD will provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process.
About Us
Why GHD?
Being the best we can be is in our culture.
We are a family of smart, innovative and creative problem solvers. In our employee-owned company, everything feels like it matters more. Challenge us and help us come up with new solutions to ensure water, energy and urbanisation are made sustainable for generations to come.
 More about Life and Work @GHD 
Our commitment to you
Commitment is a powerful word that defines how we do business, how we serve our clients and how we care for one another. We will support your needs by giving you the tools to do your best work and then recognise achievements. We will set your curiosity free to allow brilliant minds to do their best work. We will invest in new ideas, removing barriers where we can. Finally, we will encourage you to collaborate with thousands of diverse people across our global business.
 Our Commitment to you 
Who we are
We are committed to solving the world's biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy and urbanisation . GHD is a global professional services company that is a leader in engineering, construction and architectural expertise. Established in 1928, we remain wholly owned by our people. We are 10,000+ diverse and skilled individuals, yet we are proudly ‘One GHD’ across more than 200 offices, spanning five continents – Asia, Australia, Europe, North and South America, and the Pacific region. Delivering extraordinary social and economic outcomes, we are passionate about building lasting relationships with our partners and clients.
 GHD Expertise and Service Lines

jobDescription:
We’re building the next generation of capital markets technology. Global capital markets are an ocean of fast-moving, interrelated and complex data. We are looking for passionate and enthusiastic problem-solvers with expertise in capital markets data to join us as we continue providing technology innovation and support to the world’s leading global capital markets companies.
Current strategic pursuits
The Data Engineer will be responsible for data processing pipelines. We have the mission of "Capturing, Storing and Transforming" the world's market data. Our data team manages the data pipelines that flow between each of those stages. The role has a large operational component while also requiring someone to envision future growth in both utilization and technology selection for the components of the work.
Work Qualifications
Significant experience with Python and ability to write and maintain object-oriented Python applications is a mustExperience with processing job management – experience using one or more of the following: Jenkins, Rundeck, Apache Airflow or other task scheduling softwareTime spent working in a batch data processing environment or other environment where large data jobs are performed using automationExperience with ETL pipelines and Data LakesGit version control systems - GitLab and/or GitHubProficiency with Linux and an understanding of Linux server architecture and operationShould be very comfortable with data copying, scheduling tasks and Linux daemons
Nice To Haves, But Not Required
Experience with AWS data warehouse, Redshift, Athena, Dremio or SnowflakeExperience with Google Cloud BigQueryExperience with and knowledge of US and International market dataExperience with multicast market dataExperience with monitoring and visualization systems such as Nagios, Prometheus and GrafanaExperience with time series databasesExperience with AWS S3Experience with Docker and KubernetesC/C++ programming experienceBash / Shell Scripting experience
At LSEG, we believe that creating a diverse and inclusive organisation is fundamental to the way we deliver on our promise of creating essential partnerships and open opportunities. Our open culture is central to how we deliver our purpose – driving financial stability, empowering economies and enabling customers to create sustainable growth – in everything we do.
Working with us means that you will be part of a dynamic organisation of 25,000 people across 70 countries. However, we will value your individuality and enable you to bring your true self to work so you can help enrich our diverse workforce. You will be part of a collaborative and creative culture where we encourage new ideas and are committed to sustainability across our global business. You will experience the critical role we have in helping to re-engineer the financial ecosystem to support and drive sustainable economic growth. Together, we are aiming to achieve this growth by accelerating the just transition to net zero, enabling growth of the green economy and creating inclusive economic opportunity.
LSEG offers a range of tailored benefits and support, including healthcare, retirement planning, paid volunteering days and wellbeing initiatives.
We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. This means that we do not discriminate on the basis of anyone’s race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. Conforming with applicable law, we can reasonably accommodate applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.
Please take a moment to read this privacy notice carefully, as it describes what personal information London Stock Exchange Group (LSEG) (we) may hold about you, what it’s used for, and how it’s obtained, your rights and how to contact us as a data subject.
If you are submitting as a Recruitment Agency Partner, it is essential and your responsibility to ensure that candidates applying to LSEG are aware of this privacy notice.
companyDescription:
LSEG (London Stock Exchange Group) is a diversified international markets infrastructure business —earning our clients’ trust for over 300 years. That legacy of customer-focused excellence ensures that you can rely on our expertise in capital formation, intellectual property and risk and balance sheet management. 

As global leaders in financial indexing, benchmarking and analytic services, we offer unrivalled access to international capital markets. Our high-performance technology solutions enable companies worldwide to access funds for growth and development. And with our Data & Analytics, Capital Markets and Post Trade divisions, we provide a comprehensive, integrated suite of trusted financial market infrastructure services that help our customers pursue—and achieve—their ambitions. 

You can count on our open access model for unparalleled partnership, flexibility, stability, and support across all of our businesses. That’s how we make a difference— ensuring people can meet their potential—worldwide.

jobDescription:
Reference No. R2662889

Position Title:  Payroll Services Specialist - Vaccines

Department: CA Payroll

Location: Toronto

Sanofi Pasteur: The world’s leading vaccine company

Sanofi Pasteur, the vaccines division of Sanofi, is the largest company in the world devoted entirely to human vaccines. Our driving goal is to protect people from infectious diseases by creating safe and effective vaccines. Our company distributes more than 1 billion doses of vaccine each year, making it possible to vaccinate more than 500 million people across the globe. Sanofi Pasteur offers the broadest range of vaccines in the world, providing protection against 20 bacterial and viral diseases.

Sanofi is dedicated to supporting people through their health challenges. We are a global biopharmaceutical company focused on human health. We prevent illness with vaccines, provide innovative treatments to fight pain and ease suffering. We stand by the few who suffer from rare diseases and the millions with long-term chronic conditions. With more than 100,000 people in 100 countries, Sanofi is transforming scientific innovation into healthcare solutions around the globe.

Position Summary:

The incumbent will be responsible for the following:

Accurately and Timely processing Canadian payroll.Updating payroll system with employee information as required.Correcting employee time off and time worked as required.Updating time management system with historical corrections as required.Updating payroll manager with all suggested improvements and enhancements to drive payroll productivity and reduce payroll errors and off cycles.

Key Responsibilities:

Completing the full payroll process, including: data entry relating to payroll, supporting data uploads, ensuring payroll timelines and processes are followed timely and accurately, generating of audit reports, resolution of errors and signing off of final payroll reports to managed service team.Ensuring Senior Payroll Associates are aware of any system errors or issues.Offering excellent customer service.Keeping the necessary procedures up to date for the proper functioning of the payroll department.Helping to create and maintain strong team spirit and mutual support within the department.Ensuring payroll processes are compliant to internal and external requirements.Supporting all year end activities to create all year end forms.Supporting the creation of the new annual payroll calendar.Supporting the improved employee experience by communicating to payroll manager any suggested employee scripts and portal updates.Supporting the Senior Payroll Associates as required in all aspects of the end to end payroll processing and provide back up support where required.

Key Requirements:

Minimum College diploma.Minimum 3 years of experience in payroll.Ability to speak French is preferred.A self-motivated individual with a customer-centric mindset.Ability to effectively cope with the demands of the role.Must have PCP designation Payroll Compliance PractitionerExperience with Global view (SAP), ADP e-time, and Workday preferred.Strong Computer skills and familiarity with the following programs: Time & Attendance, HR system, Payroll system, Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Word.ADP and Kronos experience is needed

Sanofi is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. Our goal is to attract, develop and retain highly talented employees from diverse backgrounds, allowing us to benefit from a wide variety of experiences and perspectives. We welcome and encourage applications from all qualified applicants. Accommodations for persons with disabilities required during the recruitment process are available upon request.

Thank you in advance for your interest. 

Only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. 

Sanofi, Empowering Life

At Sanofi diversity and inclusion is foundational to how we operate and embedded in our Core Values. We recognize to truly tap into the richness diversity brings we must lead with inclusion and have a workplace where those differences can thrive and be leveraged to empower the lives of our colleagues, patients and customers. DescriptionRYSE is a Canadian hardware company creating the next wave of window shade IoT products based on smart and simple designs. We’re about inventing new ‘Things’ and re-writing the rules in Hardware. Our flagship product, the RYSE SmartShade was launched as a smart device that motorizes and automates existing window coverings and is controllable via smartphones and SmartHome ecosystems. We are continuously introducing new products in the window shades space with several ongoing projects in various stages of design and manufacturing.RYSE is looking for an Intermediate to Senior Product Manager to join our team. You will have the opportunity to lead the vision for new and existing smart home IoT products in the company. To be successful in this role, you need to thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy influencing, communicating, organizing and project managing across multidisciplinary teams.
Your main responsibility will be to lead Product, and the NPI (New Product Introduction) process at RYSE, working alongside our Design, Engineer, Sales and Customer Success team. This may include introducing entirely new smart home devices, as well as accessories that accompany new and existing products in our portfolio.
Salary: $70,000 - $80,000 CAD + options
You will be responsible for:Understanding of the market needs, the competition, size, players, trends, including customer pain points (through interviews, conversations, etc.).Communicating with customers, end-users, channel partners, and stakeholders to gather research.Work with our Design, Engineer, Sales, and Customer Success team to create solutions and products, translated into product requirements that balances research with intuition.Guide the company in developing “what” to build in our products, as you identify and assess opportunities and ideas, and decide which ones are worth pursuing.Develop the Product Requirements Document (PRD) or a product spec, for Industrial Design and Engineer team. The PRD must include Functional Requirements (for our design/engineer team), as well as Business and Market Requirements.Product Strategy & Roadmap – responsible for the course of the product as it grows and evolves, including future product releases.

RequirementsUniversity Degree in relevant discipline3+ years of work experience in Product Management of physical devicesExperience in working in smart home devices, IoT, and/or hardware a requirementPossess a unique blend of business and technical savvy; a big-picture vision as well as the drive and attention to details that transforms the vision into reality.Experience with success in the full product life cycle, providing product vision/roadmaps (waterfall and sprint), PRDs, and bringing to market complex products on timeAbility to set and drive “big picture” strategy, while also providing detailed guidance on individual projectsDeep understanding of user story creation, UX design as well as technical and consumer requirements gatheringStrong communication skills (verbal and written) and an appreciation for producing good documentationAn understanding of UX and industrial design principlesBasic understanding of engineeringManagement experience and experience leading a team
Apply Here: https://apply.workable.com/ryse/j/E377F046DD/apply/
companyDescription:
RYSE develops innovative window covering solutions that blend intelligence with simplicity.

The company's first product, Gear, was launched as a smart device that motorizes and automates existing window shades in minutes. Named as the 2017 Motorized Product of the Year by the Consumer Technology Association, Gear is compatible with a variety of window shades and allows you to control and schedule your shades from the comfort of your phone.

We’ve taken all the feedback we recieved on AXIS Gear and put it into RYSE SmartShades, a next generation smart shading solution launching in 2021.

Headquartered in Toronto, Canada, RYSE is on a mission to transform the window shade industry with smart and simple technology.

The future is smart. Embrace it.

jobDescription:
Au Sujet d’AGF : Fondée en 1957, La Société de Gestion AGF Limitée (AGF) est une société indépendante de gestion de placements diversifiés à l’échelle mondiale. AGF apporte de la discipline en offrant l’excellence en matière de gestion de placements par l’entremise de ses volets axés sur des activités fondamentales et quantitatives de même que sur des actifs non traditionnels et des avoirs de particuliers bien nantis. Nos solutions d’investissement diverses s’étendent à l’échelle mondiale à une vaste clientèle, depuis les conseillers financiers jusqu’aux investisseurs particuliers et aux investisseurs institutionnels comprenant des caisses de retraite, des programmes d’entreprise, des fonds souverains, des fonds de dotation et des fondations. Notre engagement à respecter les principes de bonne gérance et d’investissement responsable constitue un atout que revêt AGF. Selon nous, l’intégration des considérations environnementales, sociales et de gouvernance (« ESG ») dans nos processus décisionnels d’investissement ainsi que dans nos pratiques d’actionnariat au sein de nos plateformes aidera à procurer de meilleurs résultats d’investissement à nos clients.
Au Sujet de L’équipe :Le Service des ventes de détail est chargé de procurer des solutions à valeur ajoutée et une expérience exceptionnelle à nos conseillers. L’équipe accorde une attention particulière à l’innovation, au leadership et à l’engagement personnel. Notre croissance et notre réussite sont le résultat direct de l’engagement et du dévouement de nos employés, ainsi que de notre approche rigoureuse en matière de placement.
Au Sujet du Poste : Assurant le soutien de notre chef de la distribution au détail, à notre bureau de Montréal, vous veillerez à coordonner et à organiser efficacement tous les aspects administratifs des activités quotidiennes de l’équipe des ventes au détail.
Vos Responsabilités : Gestion du calendrier du chef de la distribution au détail, notamment planification et coordination des réunions et des rencontres avec des personnes-ressources à l’interne et à l’externe.Traitement des messages téléphoniques, des courriels et de la correspondance imprimée, afin de déterminer les priorités selon le cas et de fournir des réponses appropriées, tout en maintenant un niveau élevé de discrétion.Coordonner les réunions et les événements à l’intérieur et à l’extérieur des bureaux, y compris les services de traiteurs, les réservations de salles, la préparation des ordres du jour et des documents connexes.Maintien des dossiers et de la documentation de façon organisée, en prêtant une attention toute particulière aux détails.Assistance à la préparation de présentations et de rapports, au moyen des applications PowerPoint, Word et Excel.Coordination de tous les déplacements, y compris la planification des transports et de l’hébergement.Élaboration et soumission des états de frais de déplacements et rapprochement des relevés de cartes de crédit.Exécution d’autres tâches administratives et réalisation d’autres projets, selon la demande.
Vos Compétences : Bilingue (anglais et français)Expérience démontrée en matière de soutien administratif d’un bureau de directionAptitudes supérieures en communications écrite et verbaleHabiletés supérieures en matière d’organisation et d’attention rigoureuse aux détailsAptitudes permettant d’établir des relations interpersonnelles et d’interagir respectueusement et avec confiance avec le personnel de la direction et les personnes qui les assistent, de même qu’avec les personnes-ressources à l’externe.Respect des échéances et sens de l’urgence, capacité permettant de travailler efficacement sous pression et selon des échéanciers serrés.Aptitudes démontrées à travailler dans un milieu caractérisé par la confidentialité et à traiter des renseignements de nature délicate ou confidentielle.Expérience de travail dans un milieu dynamique et capacités permettant de s’adapter rapidement au changement.Maintien d’un comportement professionnel en tout temps.Maîtrise des applications de MicrosoftUne expérience antérieure dans le domaine des services financiers sera considérée comme un atout.Une formation en comptabilité ou en finance serait considérée comme un atout.
About AGF: Founded in 1957, AGF Management Limited is an independent and globally diverse asset management firm. AGF brings a disciplined approach to delivering excellence in investment management through its fundamental, quantitative, alternative and high-net-worth businesses. Our suite of diverse investment solutions extends globally to a wide range of clients, from individual investors and financial advisors to institutions, including pension plans, corporate plans, sovereign wealth funds, endowments and foundations. Our commitment to the principles of good stewardship and responsible investment is a positive differentiator for AGF. We believe integrating Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) issues into our investment decision-making and ownership practices across platforms will help deliver better investment outcomes to our clients.
About the Team:The Retail Sales Department is responsible for servicing our advisors by providing value add solutions and an exceptional advisor experience. The team values innovation, leadership, and personal commitment. Our growth and success are the direct result of our employees' commitment and dedication, and our disciplined approach to investing.
About the Role: Supporting our Chief Retail Distribution Officer, in our Montreal office, you will efficiently co-ordinate and organize all administrative aspects of the daily operation of the Retail Sales team.
Your Responsibilities: Management of the Chief Retail Distribution Officer’s calendar, including scheduling and coordinating meetings and visits with internal and external contacts.Review and respond to voicemail, email and hardcopy correspondence, prioritizing as appropriate, while maintaining a high degree of discretion.Coordinate meetings and events on and off-site, including catering, room bookings, agendas and meeting materials. Maintain files and documentation in an organized manner with strict attention to detail.Assist in the preparation of presentations and reports using PowerPoint, Word and Excel.Coordinate all travel arrangements including transportation and accommodations.Complete and submit expense reports and reconcile credit card statements.Execute other office duties and projects as assigned.
Your Qualifications: Fluent in English and FrenchDemonstrated experienced in providing executive office support.Superior verbal and written communication skills.Well-developed organizational skills with strict attention to detail.Relationship builder and able to interact respectfully and confidently with internal executives, executive assistants, and external contacts.Meet deadlines and possess a sense of urgency, work well under pressure and time constraints.Demonstrated ability to work in a confidential environment and handle highly sensitive information.Experience working in a fast-paced environment with the ability to adjust quickly to change.Maintains a courteous and professional manner at all times.Proficient in Microsoft applicationsPrevious experience in the Financial Services industry an asset.An accounting or financial education would be an asset.
No unsolicited agency referrals please.

Accommodations are available on request in all aspects of our recruitment and selection process. It is the Company's policy to recruit and select applicants for employment solely on the basis of their qualifications, with emphasis on selecting the best qualified person for the job. AGF does not discriminate against applicants based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, or disability or any other status or condition protected by applicable legislation.
companyDescription:
Founded in 1957, AGF Management Limited (AGF) is an independent and globally diverse asset management firm delivering excellence in investing in the public and private markets through its three distinct business lines: AGF Investments, AGF Private Capital and AGF Private Wealth.

AGF brings a disciplined approach focused on providing an exceptional client experience and incorporating sound responsible and sustainable practices. The firm’s investment solutions, driven by its fundamental, quantitative and private investing capabilities, extends globally to a wide range of clients, from financial advisors and their clients to high-net worth and institutional investors including pension plans, corporate plans, sovereign wealth funds, endowments and foundations.

Headquartered in Toronto, Canada, AGF has investment operations and client servicing teams on the ground in North America and Europe. AGF trades on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbol AGF.B.
