Big Data Engineer - Job Description
Design and implement GCP-based data solutions to meet business requirements Develop and maintain data pipelines, data models, and data warehouses Optimize data processing and data storage to improve system performance and reliability Develop ETL processes to ingest, transform, and load data from various sources into GCP Implement data security and governance best practices Troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues  
Big Data Engineer – Mandatory Skills
Bachelor's degree in computer science, Engineering, or related field 3+ years of experience in data engineering with a focus on GCP Expertise in GCP services such as BigQuery, Cloud Storage, Dataflow, Pub/Sub, DataProc Strong programming skills in Python or Java Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases Experience with version control tools such as Git Strong problem-solving and analytical skills Strong communication and collaboration skills  
Big Data Engineer - Nice to Have Skills

Big Data Engineer - Assignment Start Date ASAP – 12 months to start 
Big Data Engineer - Assignment Location Mississauga, ON – Work Hybrid

jobDescription:
Located on the western side of spectacular coastal British Columbia, Howe Sound Pulp and Paper is one of the oldest operating mills in the province. Commissioned in 1909, Howe Sound Pulp and Paper plays a key role in the history of the Sunshine Coast. Generations of families who were first attracted to the area by mill jobs, stayed and have made the Coast their home. 
Howe Sound is one of 8 facilities owned by Paper Excellence, a diversified manufacturer of pulp and paper that produces over 3 million tonnes of printing, writing, packaging, and specialty papers annually with a workforce of more than 3,000 strong.
Job Summary
Under the direction of the Manager, Technical and Environment, you will be responsible for directing the technical programs in areas of Process and Quality Improvement. The Process Engineer is accountable for the completion of the technical projects in his/her assigned area of responsibility.
Responsibilities
Carry out technical projects involving process and quality improvements and technological change. These projects will have impact on the long-term future of HSPP in terms of product quality.Direct the efforts of Process Chemists, Technicians and Technologists as assigned by the Manager, Technical & Environment.Be intimately familiar with all aspects of pulp and paper manufacturing at HSPP including product costs and available industry technology.Be alert for waste or loss of any kind, whether of time, material or equipment, and take steps to correct any of these.Develop the skills and capabilities to those junior staff working under his direction to ensure that they contribute to the best of their abilities towards the mill’s objectives.Perform other related duties as assigned by the Manager, Technical & Environment.Training/mentoring employees as required keeping them abreast of technological changes introduced into the workplace.
Qualifications
B.A. Sc. in Chemical Engineering5-7 years demonstrated industry experience.Ability to independently carry out process design work,Strong technical leadership and mentoring skillsStrong data analysis and visualization abilityExcellent time management, prioritization, and decision-making skills
companyDescription:
Paper Excellence is a diversified manufacturer of pulp and paper, including printing and writing, packaging, and specialty papers. We believe in the enduring value of wood-based products in global markets and have built a large network of mills and chipping plants to produce them competitively. Through our distinct approach to operational excellence, we deliver high-quality and cost-effective products to international customers.

We manufacture high-quality softwood and hardwood kraft chemical pulps, and chemi-thermo-mechanical pulps, that in turn are used to make packaging, papers, tissues, towels, and other specialty products. Our Catalyst facilities manufacture superior-quality specialty, printing and writing, and packaging papers for retailers, commercial printers, publishers, and customers who convert our products into their own.

We have a significant economic impact in Canada, where our operations are important drivers of local and regional economies. We create approximately $4 billion annually in economic activity through wages, tax payments, purchases of goods and services, and support of indirect employment.

So much of what we have accomplished is thanks to our incredible team of talented individuals who work tirelessly to set the industry standard and raise the bar. We warmly invite you to learn more about our company and the opportunities we have in store for you.

jobDescription:
For those who dream of advancing our space in the Universe and on Earth, we’ll take you there.
Serving the world from our Canadian home and our global offices, MDA is an international space mission partner and robotics & space operations, satellite systems and geointelligence pioneer with a 50-year story of firsts on and above the Earth. Today, we're leading the charge towards viable Moon colonies, enhanced Earth observation, communication in a hyper-connected world, and more.
We’re fueled by a pioneering spirit that carries us beyond. And together we enable highly skilled people to continually push boundaries and tackle big challenges requiring solutions that endure and inspire.
Are you ready to launch the next stage of your career in the new space economy? We would love to hear from you!
We’re on the hunt for an Automation & Production Engineer on our Satellite systems team at our Montreal office.
As the leading global independent commercial supplier of antennas, payloads, and electronics for communication and radar satellites, our team has successfully contributed to hundreds of missions in the past 60 years. With an extensive heritage in a wide range of solutions delivered to customers globally, our Satellite Systems team continues to grow and evolve on the ground and in the stars.
We’re a dream team of purpose-driven, collaborative and passionate people, and we are constantly looking for others to join #TeamMDA to ignite new and innovative approaches to problem-solving that push us forward to improve life on and above Earth. If you’re excited to expand our place in space and driven to inspire the next generation, we’ll take you there.
We have entered a new era of exploration and development, and MDA welcomes all who yearn to suit up and be part of it. An equal opportunity employer prizing diversity, integrity and collaboration, we are committed to growing MDA’s and Canada’s leadership in this next golden age.
The automation and production engineer is expected to collaborate with a multidisciplinary team to manufacture space products used on state-of-the-art satellites.
As part of a dynamic production team, the engineer is responsible for inter-program cohesion and for the assembly, integration and testing of our space products. From the design phase through assembly, testing (thermal, vibration, electrical...) and up to the reception of products at customers' premises, (s)he ensures the good quality of the product and documentation throughout the production line within time constraints and budget.
In addition to project monitoring, the engineer actively participates in the continuous improvement of the various production departments (electronics, composites, antennas, payloads, testing, etc.) Continuous improvement consists of the optimization and/or automation of tasks, the selection, evaluation and qualification of new equipment, the implementation of corrective actions, the qualification of new processes/products/subcontractors. (S)He also contributes to the implementation and monitoring of the philosophy of "Lean Manufacturing", "design for manufacturing (DFM)" and "design for automation" (DFA).
Tasks
Suggest and implement new technologies such as robots, vision systems, quality control and preventive maintenance tools in collaboration with engineering and production teamsAnalyze and validate existing processes, while participating in the design, installation and deployment of new solutionsDevelop satellite programs and databases to link our ERP/MES system with production (industry mentality 4.0)Program PCs, programmable control units, controller systems and operator interfaces to integrate new systems or optimize existing systemsCreate electrical and pneumatic plans and select the necessary technology (PC, PLC, drive, automatic control, etc.), document and implement improvement projects related to the various production equipmentDevelop and implement optimal working methods, efficient test tools and train users appropriatelyParticipate in technical program reviews (TOB) to meet production design needsRepresent the production team at MBRsMaintain, improve and diagnose production equipment already in placeWrite and update operating procedures and maintenance plans for automated equipment.Discuss with the project manager and the client to define the needsCommunicate with other team members, internally and externallyProduction support after start-upAnalyze the performance indicators of the production cellsPerform all other tasks compatible with your duties
Minimum Qualifications Required
Engineering Bachelor’s degree2-5 years of experience in a manufacturing environmentStrong interpersonal skills and ability to work in a team environmentAbility to communicate and write in both English and FrenchKnowledge of programming languages (Python, C#, SQL, C++, Java, VB (.NET), etc.) is an asset
#IND1
Comments/Special Considerations
Successful candidates must obtain and hold security clearance at the reliability status level, and pass security assessment for the Controlled Goods Program (CGP) and ITAR.
Benefits Statement
MDA provides competitive compensation and benefits packages for its employees at all locations. As a team member of MDA, you and your qualified dependents are eligible to participate in a benefit plan that ensures a comprehensive level of protection through competitive health care including; extended healthcare and flexible drug plans, dental and vision benefits, disability income protection, life insurance, group retirement savings plans; and an employee and family assistance program.
Equal Opportunity Statement
MDA is an equal opportunity employer prizing diversity and inclusion. We are committed to treating all employees and applicants for employment with respect and dignity. If you require assistance and/or reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please feel free to notify us.
COVID Statement
COVID-19 Hiring Update: Strengthening our workforce is more important than ever to meet our customers’ mission-critical needs. We are continuing to hire many talented people, and we are closely monitoring COVID-19 to ensure safe hiring practices are used. This includes limiting onsite candidate interviews and prioritizing video interviews.
#MDA
companyDescription:
Serving the world from its Canadian home and global offices, MDA is an international space mission partner and a robotics, satellite systems and geointelligence pioneer with a 50-year story of firsts on and above the Earth. With 2,700 employees in Canada, the US and the UK, MDA is leading the charge towards viable Moon colonies, enhanced Earth observation, communication in a hyper-connected world, and more. With a track record of making ambitions come true, MDA enables highly skilled people to continually push boundaries, tackle big challenges, and imagine solutions that inspire and endure to change the world for the better, on the ground and in the stars. 

MDA’s deep heritage and broad range of capabilities are organized into three business areas: Geointelligence, Robotics & Space Operations, and Satellite Systems.
 
GEOINTELLIGENCE
Our mission is to turn data into insight. From detecting changes in our fragile ecosystems to monitoring northern ice floes to exposing illegal fishing vessels, our near-real time imagery and data analytics services derived from our space-based radar and multi-sensor ground system capabilities position us as a leading provider of geointelligence to customers worldwide.
 
ROBOTICS & SPACE OPERATIONS
With 40 years of operational experience and proven performance on the iconic Canadarm programs including Space Shuttle and International Space Station robotics and operations support, our Robotics & Space Operations team has 100% mission success in making space dreams come true.
 
SATELLITE SYSTEMS
As the leading global independent commercial supplier of antennas, payloads, and electronics for communication and radar satellites, our team has successfully contributed to hundreds of missions in the past 60 years. With an extensive heritage in a wide range of solutions delivered to customers globally, our Satellite Systems team continues to grow and evolve on the ground and in the stars.

jobDescription:
Company Overview
Farmers Business Network™ (FBN™) is on a mission to power the prosperity of family farmers and rural communities around the world, transforming how the world farms with an integrated, technology enabled agricultural platform.
We offer high ROI farm inputs, fintech and sustainability products and services powered by network data, and farm-tested insights from our global farmer community. Our platform helps FBN™ members make confident decisions to ensure the economic viability of their farms, while also empowering them to be a part of the solution as the global community confronts its most pressing issues: providing food security for a growing population, transitioning to more sustainable agriculture, and responding to climate change.
We are a dynamic, innovative, and mission-driven AgTech company that offers competitive compensation and benefits as well as boundless career mobility. We are backed by top investors, including Fidelity, ADM, Google Ventures, Kleiner Perkins, DBL Partners, T Rowe Price and Temasek. We have been featured in these articles by the Wall Street Journal and Forbes, and were also named "One of the 50 Most Innovative Companies in the World" by Fast Company Magazine.
Position Summary
The Fulfillment Operations Engineer will physically support the Primary Fulfillment Center and remotely support Logistics centers within their region. The primary function of this position will be to coordinate work flows starting at inbound, progressing throughout the warehouse, and finishing in Outbound. With a near future perspective, focusing on “week of” work load, and tactically coordinating the “day of” communication, this position will be responsible for organizing and communicating the plans and goals for the operation, within the region. This individual will focus on creating the visibility needed for each regional leader through strong communication and an ability to create data tools or analytics to paint a picture of their regions execution.
Responsibilities
Planning for Success: Focused with a planning mentality, this person will help plan for each site through both weekly and daily inbound and outbound scheduling understanding. This role will help solve for the future through analytics and tool creation to help bridge visibility gaps within the region. The coordinator will do this through:Planning, confirming and setting up inbound and outbound schedules and appointment throughout the region with a strong understanding of our TMS and other system toolsDocumenting and working with external carriers or internal teams around discrepancies such as early or late arrivalsMaintaining, and archiving documentation around inbound and outbound shipments Strong cross functional communication and support to help ensure risks are identified, and mitigated when plans are not on track Application of data understanding and creation of user friendly dashboards to support regional and network understanding using SQL, Tableau, Excel, and/or Google SuiteSetting up for Execution (Start of shift, day of): The coordinator will support regional and site level leadership with day of plans, escalations, and project tracking:Adjusting inbound or outbound schedules with communications to the site, based off appointment variability for IB or OB loadsDaily Cycle count support through virtual setup of counts in WMS each dayProject organization around volumes or capacities per day ( Examples would include Relabelling demands, packaging projects, and so on)Centralized tracking of procurement or manufacturing related activities for the region Parcel shipment support for regionDaily Attainment & Execution (End of shift, day of): Track, verify, communicate, and escalate gaps between the established plans and actual execution per site: Identifies at risk customer orders for sites and communicates to local leadership for execution Works with support teams to mitigate risks including Transportation, Supply Chain Execution, and Customer ExperienceAssists with any other check and verify requests of regional leadership or supporting regional teamsSupports WMS functionality for region including (but not limited to) ICTO/ IF creation, parcel label creation, new user service desk requests, and cycle count audit creationEvening and weekend work, and/or additional hours as necessary during peak seasonTravel <10% per yearOther responsibilities as assigned

Minimum Qualifications
4 year degree in Operations Management, Logistics, Industrial Engineering, Business Administration, Mathematics OR Data Science or 6+ years of experience in a similar role and function within a Warehouse settingStrong data analysis and coding skills including experience in SQL, Redshift, and/or Python or strong experience in data organizing platforms such as Excel & Google SheetsAbility to create clean visualization of data analytics through strong experience in Tableau, Data Studios or other user facing platforms 

Preferred Qualifications
Experience solving typical warehouse problems by evaluating and selecting solutions from established optionsMinimum of 2 years or more of relevant shipping/receiving/admin experienceInventory control experienceForklift experienceExperience in using distribution and fulfillment software such as WMS, TMS, & YMSLean, APICS, or Six Sigma Certified 

Characteristics
The successful applicant will be:Strong attention to detail, good organizational skills, and the ability to prioritize with changing situationsStrong excel, google sheets and other spreadsheet related software and applications Good interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills to drive tasks to completionData minded individual with an ability to convey and message information through organized presentation of analytics 
To understand the physical demands of this job, please click this link and refer to Template D.

companyDescription:
Farmer's Business Network, Inc. is an independent agricultural tech and commerce platform and farmer-to-farmer network that helps its members make confident decisions to ensure the economic viability of their farms and work toward a sustainable future.

FBN is an advocate for family farmers and ranchers, and does whatever it takes to help farmers become more prosperous - whether it's through data science-driven agronomic insights about their fields, providing farm inputs through its e-commerce store, helping farmers sell their crop more intelligently and independently, or providing them with health or crop insurance. FBN arms farmers with the tools they need to make the best decisions for their business, their families and the planet.

jobDescription:
A little about Capital Power 
Capital Power (TSX: CPX) is dedicated to powering a sustainable future for people and planet. Headquartered in Edmonton, Alberta, we're a growth-oriented North American power producer that creates innovative electricity solutions to electrify the world reliably and affordably while protecting the planet for future generations.
From Alberta to Alabama, we're innovating power generation as a collaborative team of experts and innovators. We believe in empowering our people and supporting them with holistic benefits and programs so they can thrive in all aspects of life. We provide purpose-driven work in a safe, inclusive environment, and we live by our values. With us, your contributions matter. We're here to partner with you so you can learn, innovate, and forge a career that's meaningful to you. Join us in powering a clean energy future!
Your Opportunity 
One Permanent Full Time Position. 
Are you interested in working for a fast-growing organization which is focused on sustainable growth, committed to a low carbon future, and believes in innovation?
JOIN US and be a part of a skilled and passionate EMOC team. 
The Energy Management Operations Center (EMOC) is a dynamic and diverse team of professionals who are collaborative, passionate about learning, and want to drive change. EMOC’s Energy Management Engineers, Specialists, and Operators are critical in managing the day-to-day operations of the team and offering exceptional services for our customers. In addition, they have opportunities to leverage their talents and work on a diverse set of projects, including projects that may provide experience towards their P Eng. designation.EMOC is accountable for real-time operations of thermal, solar, and wind generating capacity in Canada and the United States. EMOC’s real-time services includes effective coordination of information amongst plant operators, balancing authorities, grid operators, transmission operators, and customers; monitoring of remote renewable assets; financial settlement; market rule compliance management; operational analytics; remote operation of renewable assets and the remote operation of York Energy Centre.
As the Energy Management Engineer, you are accountable for the real-time operation, reporting, and operational analytics for a fleet of Capital Power and third-party generating assets. With a focus on our Renewables Assets, you will provide 24/7 shift coverage to our stakeholders in operations, compliance, and commercial.
As a key member of our 24/7 team, you will contribute by Creating and managing generating asset real-time offer submissions in accordance with corporate policies, Independent System Operator (ISO) market rules, and regulatory requirements.Managing generating asset outages, testing, and ISO directives in real-time.Remotely monitoring wind farms and supporting operational analytics to maximize the sites’ value and availability.Championing projects and working with others to enhance real-time operations.Providing support to other Capital Power cross-functional teams to integrate and commission new generating assets into Capital Power’s fleet of generating assets and EMOC.Completing analytics necessary to meet EMOC’s real-time, financial settlement, risk management, operations, and reporting obligations.Maintaining process/system documentation, training guides, and tools.Identifying and providing recommendations on how systems and processes can be improved or enhanced.Completing accurate and timely operational analytics for stakeholders or the manager and upon request.Proactively identifying and leading ad-hoc projects that supports EMOC’s business plan objectives.Executing projects for Capital Power’s Engineering teams, or other teams, as required.Participating in rotations or other short-term support in technical or business teams, as opportunities arise.
What you will bring to the role 
Knowledge:Undergraduate degree in Engineering; coursework related to the power and/or wind industry preferred.Mechanical, electrical, and other technical knowledge of power plant and wind farm operations considered an asset.P. Eng. or working towards P. Eng., or other applicable designation/certification.Knowledge of Alberta’s, Ontario’s, or other North American power markets; commodity markets; and trading a considerable asset.Coursework and experience related to the power industry, management information systems, resource economics, or operations management an asset.
Technical Skills:Proven problem solving and analytical reasoning skills with impeccable attention-to-detail.Excellent oral and written communication skills.Demonstrated success managing projects.Ability to understand and interpret applicable regulations to real-time operations.Proficiently manages, summarizes, and models large amounts of data.Knowledge of machine learning and programming experience (R, MATLAB, Python, SQL, Visual Basic) considered an asset.
What Else?
Social Process Skills:Positive, results oriented attitude with a team-based perspective.Effectively communicates with internal and external stakeholders, and across various levels of the organization.Ability to quickly make decisions and respond to changing circumstances in a fast-paced environment and with incomplete information.Remain calm and assertive during busy situations.Always curious and independently seeks to acquire knowledge and solutions to problems.
Working Conditions:
The role requires shift work to maintain 24/7 coverage, including nights, weekends, and holidays. The rotating shift schedule is released in advance and has flexibility to work around vacations and other commitments throughout the year.
Additional Details
As this is a safety sensitive position, clearance of a pre-employment drug & alcohol test is required.
In order to be considered for this role you must be legally eligible to work in Canada.
The successful candidate for this position will undergo an education verification, reference checks and criminal record check. We believe that creating a culture that supports employee physical, mental, financial, and social wellbeing is critical to our success. That is why we provide flexible and affordability employee benefits, retirement savings, and paid time off programs. We also provide comprehensive onboarding, training, and programs supporting your career development.
Depending on the posting requirements relocation assistance may be available.
How To Apply and Next Steps
Capital Power only accepts resumes via online application at www.capitalpower.com/careers. If you choose to submit your resume by any other means, we cannot guarantee that your application will be considered for vacancies.
Applicants with disabilities who require a reasonable accommodation to complete their application can request accessible formats, communication support, or other accessibility assistance by contacting careers@capitalpower.com.
Capital Power is committed to providing a fair and transparent hiring process. We recognize and embrace the value of diversity and hire employees with the appropriate skills, experience and knowledge for each position.
Thank you for taking the time to apply and expressing interest in powering a sustainable future with Capital Power! We wish that we could personally respond to everyone who applies; however, it is our practice to contact only those individuals selected for interviews.
To apply on this position please go to www.capitalpower.com/careers and search for JR805443.
companyDescription: Capital Power (TSX: CPX) is a growth-oriented North American wholesale power producer with a strategic focus on sustainable energy headquartered in Edmonton, Alberta.

jobDescription:
Rehabilitation Service Specialist (RSS)Status: Permanent Full-time and Temporary Full-time Opportunities Location: Remote; Western Canada
Partners in Canadian Veterans Rehabilitation Services (PCVRS), a national provider for Veterans Affairs Canada, is now welcoming Veterans and their families into a newly expanded Rehabilitation Services and Vocational Assistance Program. The Rehabilitation Program provides access to medical, psycho-social and vocational services to help ensure a successful transition to life after service for Veterans. 
The RSS has a passion for working within motivated, diverse and engaged teams. A background in medical, psychosocial, or vocational Rehabilitation Services combined with an inspired vision and purpose, will ensure the organization maintains quality client service and an environment of continuous learning and improvement. As part of a strong and professional team, you make a difference at the personal and community level by ensuring Veterans achieve their vocational and medical/psychosocial rehabilitation goals, by providing support.

What You BringA current health professional designation is required (including, but not limited to, Registered Occupational Therapist, Registered Social Worker, Registered Nurse, Certified Kinesiologist)A minimum of three (3) years’ experience in the direct provision of medical, psycho-social or vocational rehabilitation services (or a combination thereof) to ParticipantsExperience conducting medical, psycho-social or vocational rehabilitation assessmentsExperience working with persons living with mental or physical health problems creating barriers to civilian lifeExperience analyzing and interpreting medical, psycho-social or vocational assessments and making recommendations based upon critical analysis of information leading to the development of a comprehensive plan and program of careExperience working with a variety of health professionals and disciplines in an interdisciplinary team environment.

jobDescription:
Position: Data Engineer

Location: Montreal

Salary: $85K to $90K per year

We are seeking a highly skilled Data Engineer with Azure Stack experience to join this team. Our client is a leading organization in their industry and is looking for someone with strong technical expertise in Azure Stack to help drive their data initiatives.

Benefits
 10% bonus of base salary Medical benefits that start as of day 1 Wellness account Dental, vision, etc. Pension plan full contributed by employer

Duties And Responsibilities
 Participate in the conception, development, deployment and optimization of data pipelines, Data Lake, Datawarehouse for varied data integration/ingestion use cases (for example: interfaces between systems, IoT data point ingestion) Collaborate with Analysts and Architects in the design of Datawarehouse and integration datasets Contribute to brainstorming discussions and solution definition related to information architecture and design, data collection, data analysis methodology, data normalization, enterprise data dictionaries, cross system data integration Perform problem solving and testing of hypotheses and complex analysis of data Perform data modelling for proper analysis and insight Document, and implement best practices Write and maintain unit tests, integration tests and performance tests Analyze, identify, diagnose, document and assist to resolve a pplication issues, d ata issues Deploy and merge solutions using Azure DevOps

Qualification And Skills
 Bachelor’s degree in computer science or an equivalent combination of education and/or experience Strong analytical and organisational skills, with a passion for problem solving and uncovering and reconciling details Strong knowledge of data integration concepts Is genuinely enthusiastic about all forms of data and actively keeps informed about the latest technologies and data warehousing trends Ability to work with IT and business personnel Experience in any of the following areas is a plus: Agile methodology, Transportation industry Knowledge of Big data ingestion BI / Analytics 2-5 years hands-on data engineering experience: Coding: SQL, T-SQL, noSQL, Python, C# Familiarity with relational and non-relational databases ELT/ETL: ingestion of disparate systems (through rest API, sftp, SQL databases, etc.) Data Layer (Data Lake / Data Warehouse) Knowledge in the following topics are required: ADLS Gen 2, Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure Functions, Azure DevOps, etc.

Knowledge in one of the following topics is an asset:
 Oracle E-Business Suite (EBS), specifically BI Publisher SharePoint Business Data Connectivity (BDC) to create and maintain lists Automated testing Coding: R, Scala Azure ML/AI Familiarity with Databricks Unity Catalog

Other Details
 T ech stack includes Azure Data Lake, Databricks (Delta Lake, Parquet files, etc., Unity Catalog), Synapse, Azure Functions, PowerBI At least 1 day a week at the Montreal Office (Mondays) – subject to change at manager’s discretion

If you are passionate about data engineering and have a strong technical background in Azure Stack, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Our client offers competitive compensation packages, excellent benefits, and a dynamic work environment.

Please send your resume in Word format to Anjali Kastwar at anjali.kastwar@quantum-qtr.com .

REFER A PERM HIRE AND EARN $1,000!  For more details, click here . Conditions apply.

OUR VIRTUAL DOORS ARE OPEN! We’re also bringing the interviews to you by various web applications, virtually! Contact us today for your next opportunity.

jobDescription:
Job Description
Join a global professional services leader. We are committed to solving the world’s biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy and urbanization.
Due to continuing growth, we are seeking an Environmental Engineer/Geologist/Scientist with experience in contaminated sites and remediation to join our Contamination Assessment and Remediation Team in our Calgary, AB office.
The successful candidate will:
 Work in cooperation with a multi-disciplinary project team to complete projects incorporating contaminated sites investigation and remediation, solid waste management  Assist with data compilation, analysis, and evaluation using the application of engineering principles and problem-solving skills under the supervision of a project manager  Prepare technical documents, including draft work plans, reports, and correspondence  Assist with the development of technical designs, including design reports, specifications, drawings, and tender documents  Prepare project support documents, including health and safety plans  Communicate with vendors and contractors  Assist with contract administration and cost control  Assist with field work, including environmental monitoring, drilling oversight, and remediation contractor oversight  Research, review and understand provincial and federal acts, and regulations  Participate in design and project management meetings 
Report Writing:
 Responsible for creating draft reports to be reviewed by supervisor or project manager  Responsible for creating charts and figures for review by project manager  Assist in the preparation of project related memorandums  Assisting Project Manager with proposal writing 
Project Management:
 Assist the Project Manager on projects including coordination of field activities, manage field personnel, analytical set up and working with subcontractors  Coordination of technical resources and personnel including drafting, database, chemistry, and staff through project duration  Assist with special projects as needed 
Desired Skills & Experience:
 Bachelor’s degree in Environmental, Civil, Geological, or Chemical Engineering, Geology, or Environmental Science  1 to 3 years of field experience / experience in contamination assessment and remediation.  Self-starter and finisher, detail orientated, flexible, team player, and willing and able to do a wide variety of tasks with minimal supervision  Positive attitude, safety-mindedness, and excellent communication and interpersonal skills (oral and written)  Strong technical writing, data analysis and interpretation skills  Strong organizational skills, ability to manage various tasks, and willingness to meet challenging deadlines  Willing to travel for work and able to conduct fieldwork  Strong Microsoft Office skills: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, and Outlook  Eligible for APEGA membership  Must hold a Class 5 AB Driver’s license 
As a diverse and inclusive organization, we encourage individual achievement and recognize the strength of a diverse workforce. GHD is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, GHD will provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process.
About Us
Why GHD?
Being the best we can be is in our culture.
We are a family of smart, innovative and creative problem solvers. In our employee-owned company, everything feels like it matters more. Challenge us and help us come up with new solutions to ensure water, energy and urbanisation are made sustainable for generations to come.
Our commitment to you
Commitment is a powerful word that defines how we do business, how we serve our clients and how we care for one another. We will support your needs by giving you the tools to do your best work and then recognise achievements. We will set your curiosity free to allow brilliant minds to do their best work. We will invest in new ideas, removing barriers where we can. Finally, we will encourage you to collaborate with thousands of diverse people across our global business.
Who we are
We are committed to solving the world's biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy and urbanisation . GHD is a global professional services company that is a leader in engineering, construction and architectural expertise. Established in 1928, we remain wholly owned by our people. We are 10,000+ diverse and skilled individuals, yet we are proudly ‘One GHD’ across more than 200 offices, spanning five continents – Asia, Australia, Europe, North and South America, and the Pacific region. Delivering extraordinary social and economic outcomes, we are passionate about building lasting relationships with our partners and clients.

jobDescription:
Dana is a global leader in the supply of highly engineered driveline, sealing, and thermal-management technologies that improve the efficiency and performance of vehicles with both conventional and alternative-energy powertrains. Serving three primary markets – passenger vehicle, commercial truck, and off-highway equipment – Dana provides the world's original-equipment manufacturers and the aftermarket with local product and service support through a network of nearly 100 engineering, manufacturing, and distribution facilities.
Company Description
Dana Canada Corporation’s Power Technologies, a producer of automotive battery coolers for electric and hybrid vehicles - has an opening for an Environmental, Safety and Security Coordinator at our Franklin Blvd., Cambridge, Ontario location.
Job Duties And Responsibilities
 Reporting to the Engineering Manager, the successful applicant’s duties will be: 
 Support daily production cells by troubleshooting, collecting and monitoring data to ensure equipment uptime and appropriate throughputs are being achieved hourly and daily by using analysis tools such as Microsoft excel and equipment software;  Be the point of contact in the production cells to resolve equipment issues;  Working with a cross functional team in-plant and external Advanced Engineering including sales, quality, environmental, health & safety, production, program management, facilities and engineering, ensure stage gates and product launches meet all Dana requirements within the allotted budget, costs, KPI and customer specifications;  Identify and troubleshoot equipment and where required, coordinate, supervisor and liaise with outside contractors and maintenance personnel to ensure productivity, quality, safety and continuous improvement objectives are met; maintain productive relationships that enable positive partnerships;  Prepare reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing data to recognize, identify and forward trends to the management team; take action based on recommendation to improve key performance indicators relating to equipment or plant functioning;  Participate as a key member in implementing the Dana Operating System (DOS) principles and philosophies throughout the plant by initiating and coordinating 5S and Kaizen workshops; improve manufacturing efficiency by utilizing a cross functional team to analyze and plan workflow, space requirements, and equipment layout;  Ensure adherence to the Contractor Safety Program by completing all required paperwork; follow all Dana required safety training in all aspects of daily work.  Work with Team Leaders and production supervisors to drive continual improvement activities with the goal of improving overall plant key performance indicators, successfully motivating staff to participate in events and outcomes. 
Key Qualifications
 The successful applicant will have: 
 University degree in Mechanical Engineering or Engineering Technology degree or 3 year Engineering Technologist diploma;  Experience with heat exchangers or heat transfer principles, knowledge of fluid mechanics and/or materials are an asset;  Knowledge of Lean manufacturing practices and problem-solving techniques;  Certification in Lean Six Sigma;  In depth knowledge of health and safety legal requirements, including CSA standards;  Knowledge of industrial ergonomics;  Intermediate to advanced MS Office skills, including Excel and PowerPoint to analyze data;  Good organizational and time management skills,  Ability to work independently to support the engineering, maintenance and production teams. 
 Note(s): 
 Dana applicants must have their supervisor’s prior approval to apply.  There may be some required business travel to the United States. 
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.
Unsolicited Resumes from Third-Party Recruiters
Please note that as per Dana policy, we do not accept unsolicited resumes from third-party recruiters unless such recruiters were engaged to provide candidates for a specified opening. Any employment agency, person or entity that submits an unsolicited resume does so with the understanding that Dana will have the right to hire that applicant at its discretion without any fee owed to the submitting employment agency, person or entity.
companyDescription:
Wheeled transportation might be taken for granted today, but more than a century ago the idea of propelling carriages with motors instead of horses was nothing short of outlandish. The idea succeeded, though, thanks to the brilliance of inventors who embraced the increasingly mechanized world, the risk-taking of entrepreneurs who believed in its potential, and the business savvy of industrialists who scaled start-up ventures to large enterprises that propelled the whole industry forward.

Among those pioneers were the founders of Dana Incorporated – Clarence Spicer, Joseph Victor, Hugo Reinz, J.B. Long, and Charles Dana among them. Their initiative and ingenuity still drives Dana today in our mission to anticipate and address our customers’ needs with innovative solutions.

We’re always looking for talented people to join the Dana team. Browse current job openings at http://www.dana.com/careers.

You can also connect with us at www.facebook.com/danaincorporated or www.twitter.com/DanaInc_

jobTitle: NG2023 - Junior Rail Operation and Simulation Analyst - Vancouver
jobDescription:
Requisition ID: 86939
Job Category: Campus; Infrastructure
Location: Vancouver, BC, Canada
Join a company that is passionately committed to the pursuit of a better world through positive change. With more than 65 years of business and technical expertise in mining , energy , and infrastructure , our 10,000 colleagues in 150 countries tirelessly work toward bettering the industries in which we operate. With practical solutions that are safe, innovative and sustainable, we think globally while acting locally. Are you looking for an opportunity to join a diverse group of professionals who are committed to remaining exceptional? We look forward to hearing from you.
Our expertise in infrastructure includes aviation, highways and bridges, planning and advisory services, ports, rail and transit, tunnels, and water. Want to be part of the creation and construction of our cities? Then the infrastructure team is for you!
Our people are our greatest assets. Our employees are empowered to challenge status quo as we create solutions that are smarter, more efficient, and innovative.
If you’re passionate and committed to building a better world through positive change, our global organization may just have the opportunity you desire.
We are seeking a Junior Rail Operation and Simulation Analyst to join our Rail & Transit group located in our Vancouver office.
Responsibilities
 Responsible for building, amending, and simulating railway network simulation models using industry and best practice standards;  Participates in a variety of rail network analyses, studies, simulation model development or optimization, and technical report generation addressing a wide range of operating, infrastructure and performance improvement;  Perform operational analysis to support the decision-making of railway engineering components including trackwork, signaling, rolling stock, timetabling, stabling, etc.;  Validate system requirements through operational analysis and rail network planning;  Participating with senior leaders in the establishment of short- and long-term plans 
Qualifications
 Bachelor’s degree in civil, mechanical, electrical, or systems engineering;  Internship experience from past university co-op engineering program is preferred;  Proficiency with a programming language and the ability to analyze and visualize large dataset are desirable;  Interested in and motivated to learn railway timetabling and simulation software;  Strong organization, interpersonal, communication, problem solving, and analytical skills;  Ability to work under limited supervision  Self-motivated and have a strong interest in rail operation 
Why join us?
Work with great people to make a differenceCollaborate on exciting projects to develop innovative solutions Top employer 
What we offer you?
Flexible work environmentLong term career developmentThink globally, work locally
Don't meet every single requirement? You don't need to. At Hatch, we are building a diverse, inclusive workplace that fosters innovation. If you're interested in this role, we encourage you to apply even if your past experiences don't perfectly align with the skills we've listed.
We're committed to fostering a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we operate and serve. Hatch is an Equal Opportunity Employer that considers applicants without regard to age, race, color, national origin, citizenship, religion, creed, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected status. If you have any accommodation requirements, please let us know. We'll do our best to meet your needs in accordance with applicable local legislation.

jobDescription:
The Trail Operations complex is an integrated smelting and refining operation that produces zinc, lead, silver, cadmium, indium, fertilizers, sulphuric acid and other products. The diversity of the operations offers many challenging technical opportunities to engineers.

Engineering graduates are assigned to an Engineer-in-Training Development Program designed to provide a staged progression of learning and development opportunities leading to the position of Process Engineer. The program addresses the needed competencies, skills and abilities for the EIT to be successful in their job.

Successful applicants can expect EIT assignments which will familiarize them with the operating procedures and technical processes of various plants. Work assignments potentially include troubleshooting and improvement of existing processes, implementation of new technology, process optimization, production duties, development of new processes and participation in experimental plant trials or campaigns.

Join us in the welcoming community of Trail, situated in the beautiful West Kootenay region of southeastern British Columbia. Here you will find outdoor adventure at your fingertips! Whether it’s biking and skiing, or the laid-back atmosphere of fishing and hiking, there is something for everyone.

This position offers a compressed workweek with alternating Fridays off and comes with a competitive pay and benefits package. Come experience what work life balance is all about!

Qualifications

Be a courageous safety leader, adhere to and sponsor safety and environmental rules and proceduresMaterials, Process or Chemical Engineering Degree Previous co-op or work experience in a similar industry is an assetMotivated self-starter with the ability to manage numerous projects simultaneouslyStrong written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills Proactive approach and willingness to learnProficient in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Teams) Willingness to participate in day-to-day troubleshooting in an operating plant, process simulation and optimization, and laboratory test workDemonstrated ability to gather and analyze data to identify key trends and determine root cause

We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for the position; however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

Teck is a diversified resource company committed to responsible mining and mineral development with major business units focused on copper, steelmaking coal, zinc and energy.

jobDescription:
Company Description
We are a global team of dedicated and experienced architects, engineers, planners, designers and technology professionals who share a common desire – to help our clients create livable, sustainable, and advanced urban environments.
IBI Group is now proudly a part of Arcadis. Together, we are committed to improving the quality of life for our clients, people, partners and the communities we all serve.
Job Description
Arcadis IBI is seeking an Environmental Professional (Scientist, Engineer or Biologist) to join our small (9-10 person) close knit team in Vancouver, BC, with ability and interest to travel as required. This position has the flexibility of a hybrid work situation, working in an “in-office work” environment in our downtown Vancouver office or working remotely in BC, but with field work often from a location within travel distance to the office. Field work is usually 1-2 weeks per month, M-F but depends on the project and time of year.
Do you love the outdoors? This is a great opportunity to develop your environmental career within a positive and knowledgeable team of professionals and talented mentors.
Most of the things you’ll work on:
Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Fieldwork, including groundwater sampling, soil characterization and sampling, soil vapour/indoor air sampling and remediation monitoring.Phase 2 Site Assessments, Detailed Site Investigations, Confirmation of RemediationSite inspections, Phase 1 Site Assessments, and compliance audit supportSubcontractor oversite including drillers, utility locators, etc.Data management (primarily using Excel), to review and analyze lab resultsWriting and preparation of various detailed reports, work plans, letters, and memoranda for clients and government authoritiesConducting project-related research (historical data, regulations, etc.),
Qualifications
You'll Need to Have:
Bachelor’s Degree in Biology, Chemistry, Environmental Science, Engineering, Geology, or Agrology; ASSET: Achieving or “on track” with achieving your professional designation in Engineering (P.Eng), Geoscience (P.Geo.), Biology (RPBio), Chemistry (P.Chem.), or Agrology (P.Ag.) would be considered as an added value2+ years or more of related environmental work experience, including environmental and construction monitoring such as overseeing soil disturbance sites for contamination remediation, earthworks excavation and soil relocation related workStrong attention to detail and accuracyGood communication skills, both interpersonal and writtenEffective time management skillsStrong skills in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)Possessing a Valid Class 5 driver’s license is mandatory; (work related travel will be compensated)NOTE: Must also have access to a reliable vehicle for field work and carry a minimum of $2,000,000 third party liability insurance with their personal automobile insurance coverageA commitment to Health and Safety excellence is essentialWillingness to work independently in a field setting for extend periods of time, at times, with some work taking place in remote areas
Additional Information
Our employees will find a work environment where collaboration is at the core of the business. We proudly support our team members through continuing education, completion of licenses and certifications, memberships in professional societies, seminar and conference attendance.
Competitive Base Salary based on industry standardsRobust Extended + Medical BenefitsParticipation in Incentives Program3% RSP Matching ProgramCoverage of Licensing Fees and Annual Dues to Professional AssociationsProfessional Development & Self-Directed Learning Resources
We thank all applicants for their interest and their resume submission. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Arcadis IBI Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.
